title: Primary Human Fibroblast Cell Culture

authors.name: Aparna Kumar
authors.affiliation: Schuele Laboratory, Department of Pathology, Stanford University, Stanford, CA

authors.name: Faria Zafar
authors.affiliation: Schuele Laboratory, Department of Pathology, Stanford University, Stanford, CA

authors.name: Birgitt Schuele
authors.affiliation: Schuele Laboratory, Department of Pathology, Stanford University, Stanford, CA

source.description: Store cryovials in liquid nitrogen storage tank upon arrival. Place vials in dry ice when ready to work with cells (do not thaw immediately).

Warm up AmnioMax media in water bath, wipe bottle with 70% alcohol before placing in a biosafety cabinet. Aliquot
of the AmnioMax media into a 15 ml conical tube.

Thaw the cells by holding the lower half of the vial in
water bath and carefully swirling the vial around until only a small amount of ice is left in the vial. Do not let cells thaw completely. Wipe vial with 70% alcohol, before placing in biosafety cabinet.
Carefully remove the cap of vial and gently mix by triturating using a P1000 micropipette to resuspend the cells without causing foam.

Using a p1000 micropipette, take
of media from the 15 ml conical tube and add to the vial with cells drop by drop. Note: depending on the size of the croyvial adjust the volume. Standard cryovials hold 1.5-2.0 ml.

Centrifuge the 15 ml conical tube containing the cells and the medium at
for
. Note: always balance centrifuge.

Using a p20 micropipette, remove
from the vial for cell counting and add to a 1.5 ml microcentrifuge tube or onto a piece of parafilm.

Take the 1.5 ml microcentrifuge tube or drop on parafilm from step 6 and add
of Trypan Blue and gently mix by pipetting up and down.
Take the 15 ml conical tube from the centrifuge and aspirate Amniomax media until there is only a little left above the cell pellet.

Prepare culture dish to thaw fibroblasts by adding
of 0.1% gelatin (autoclaved) to a culture dish and incubate at room temperature for
.
Note: For plating density of human fibroblasts use 1.0-1.4 x 10^4 cells/cm^2, e.g. for T25 flask plate 2.5 x 10^5 – 3.5 x 10^5. If cells are plated too sparse the grow slows down and cells go into senescence.
20 - 30% confluency should be reached 24 hours after the cells have been plated (the following day) 24hrs after plating. Figure Legend: Example of a human fibroblast cell culture
The whole media should be changed every 2 days until 90-100% confluency is reached, at which point the cells should be passaged.
Record the label of the vial (ID, date frozen, any other documentation) and document in inventory.

Aspirate gelatin and add
of AmnioMax media to the culture dish.

Using a p1000 micropipette, aspirate solution from cryovial and slowly add to prepared conical tube with
Amniomax (Step 4) in a drop by drop fashion.

Take
of the solution and fill cell counting slide.

Insert the cell counting slide into the cell counter and count the cells. Record the number of cells and viability and then dispose of the cell counting slide.
Based on cell counts and viability adjust the culture vessel size to plate 1.0-1.4x10^4 of viable cells per cm^2.

Add
of Amniomax media and gently triturate to resuspend the cell pellet.

Add 1ml cell solution from step 16 to the culture dish and gentle rock the culture dish back and forth to evenly distribute the cell over entire surface. Place flask in
, 5% CO2 humidified incubator.

Add
of 0.1% gelatin (autoclaved) to culture dishes (x2 T25) and incubate at room temperature for
. Note: For plating density of human fibroblasts use 1.0-1.4 x 10^4 cells/cm^2, e.g. for T25 flask plate 2.5 x 10^5 – 3.5 x 10^5. If cells are plated too sparse the grow slows down and cells go into senescence.
Warm up AmnioMax media in water bath, wipe bottle with 70% alcohol before placing in a biosafety cabinet.

Aspirate gelatin and add
of AmnioMax media to the culture dish.
Remove Fibroblasts from incubator, place culture vessel in biosafety cabinet and aspirate media.

Add
of PBS using 5ml serological pipette, swirl culture vessel, aspirate and discard PBS.

Add
of 0.25% Trypsin and incubate for
at
and 5% CO2. Firmly adherent cells can be detached quickly at 37°C. Observe the cells under microscope. The detached cells appear rounded under microscope. Tap the culture vessel gently to detach all cells.
Note: Prevent cell exposure to trypsin solution for longer periods (>=10 min)

Add
of media to neutralize the trypsin. Note: add 2 volumes of pre-warmed complete growth media (containing serum) to inactivate trypsin.
Using a pipette, completely mix cells with no clumps, transfer the cell suspension to a 15 ml conical centrifuge tube.

For cell counting, remove
of solution from the tube using a P20 micropipette and add to a 1.5 ml microcentrifuge tube, see steps under "Cell Counting".

Centrifuge the cells in the 15 ml conical tube for
at
.
Aspirate the supernatant until there is only a little left above the cell pellet.
Resuspend the cell pellet in media by gently triturating.

Remove 2.5 x 10^5 – 3.5 x 10^5 cells using a pipette (the amount of solution to pipette out is based on the number of cells which was determined by counting the cells) and add to each of the gelatin coated T25 flasks. Note: For plating density of human fibroblasts use 1.0-1.4 x 10^4 cells/cm^2, e.g. for T25 flask plate 2.5 x 10^5 – 3.5 x 10^5. If cells are plated too sparse the grow slows down and cells go into senescence.

Place cells in incubator at
and 5% CO2 and follow protocol for "Maintaining Cell Culture."

If there are cells left in the 15 ml conical centrifuge tube that need to be cryofrozen, place the tube in the centrifuge and centrifuge for
at
.
Aspirate any supernatant until there is only a little left above the cell pellet and resuspend the pellet by tapping the side of the tube.

Add
of pre-warmed complete growth media (containing serum) to the conical tube with the cells using a P1000 micropipette and gently triturate.

Add
of 20% DMSO (diluted in complete growth media) to the conical tube with the cells and gently triturate with a P1000 micropipette.

Using the pipette, transfer the cells to a Cryogenic Vial and label the vial. Note: If the time it will take between filling the vials and placing them in
will be quite long, keep the vials in ice as they are being filled and transfer them to the freezing container once you are at the
freezer.

Place the Cryogenic Vial in a Cryogenic Vial freezing system container and place in
. Note: Make sure all of the holes in the freezing conatiner are filled so that the temperature spreads evenly.

Transfer the vials from the
to a Liquid Nitrogen tank no earlier than
after putting them in
.

Thaw
Chang C supplement and wipe bottle with 70% alcohol before placing in a biosafety cabinet.
Take the AmnioMax Basal Media and the Fungizone and wipe both bottles with 70% alcohol before placing in a biosafety cabinet.

Using a 50 ml pipette, aliquot
and using a 25 ml pipette, add the
Chang C supplement to the media.

Add
of Fungizone to the media.

Wrap the media container in foil to protect in the light and place in
until ready for use. Complete media can be stored at
for one month.
Aspirate the media the cells are in and then add new media (the media should be warmed up and the bottles should be wiped down with 70% alcohol before use).

materials.name: EZ-LINE Serological Pipettes, 5ml stripette, Sterile, indiv wrapped, 250 per case
Corning® Cryogenic Vials with Orange Caps, 2 mL 500 Vials
Trypan Blue Solution 0.4% (w/v) in PBS pH 7.5 ± 0.5
Nunc™ EasYFlask™ Cell Culture Flasks T25 Solid
Thermo Scientific™ Molecular BioProducts™ SoftFit-L Reload™ System: Sterile Tips
Corning LX CoolCell Freezing System for Cryogenic Vials green 12 exposed vials; 1/ea

description:
Growing and maintaining primary human skin fibroblast cell cultures.
Additional links for protocols can be found:
  • https://www.coriell.org/0/PDF/Fibroblast_Culture_FAQ.pdf
  • https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/23852182
